channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish absolutely everywhere, 25th August
item.description:
What do we paying council tax for honestly. Clean it up please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111, Bowes Road, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Bin by Bus Stop, 25th August
item.description:
This bin is constantly being used for domestic waste resulting in fixes getting in amongst it and leaving waste all over the pavement. This is unhygienic and extremely unsightly. Can this be replaced by a a sealed bin so animals can’t get into it? Can anything be done by the constant fly tipping there. The neighbour across the road has a camera doorbell and I’m sure could assist in identifying who is responsible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, Barry Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste dumped on pathway next to bicycle lockers., 25th August
item.description:
Last week I reported waste dumped at the end of Crampton street. Again this week more waste has been dumped. This situation is recurrent and unacceptable, sometimes the waste is so big that blocks the entrance of my bicycle locker entrance blocking me free access to by bike. I call on the Southwark Council to do something more drastic about this, this has been happening for quite a while and I can't bear it any more. It's truly disgusting, filthy, smelly, anti aesthetic, unhygienic, takes space right on a passageway. Please can you come up with some more permanent solution to this problem, whether you put a sign, hang a banner, threat of a penalty, CCTV cameras, whatever you think is more appropriate and effective, please! Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85-107, Rodney Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling not collected AGAiN, 25th August
item.description:
Reported as a missed collection on 21/08/25 . Still not collected and other people now adding to the bags! Please collect and sweep the street urgently.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lenthall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights both stuck on red, 25th August
item.description:
Both sets of temporary traffic lights are stuck on red causing severed traffic delay / pile up and excessive noise nuisance with cars using their horns in annoyance. Vehicles are randomly deciding when to do a red light when realising neither direction of traffic has right of way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 141, Sidcup Hill, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deceased cat, 25th August
item.description:
